intro: Euphorbia glebulosa var. almeriensis, commonly known as the Almería spurge, is a succulent plant native to southern Spain. It features a thick, fleshy stem with a distinctive greenish-gray color and a waxy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It is adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
